meta.name: Oxford Science Quarter
meta.info: Info for Science Quarter Tour in Oxford

poi.name: Wolfson Building
poi.info: Department of Computer Science, formerly Computing Laboratory.

poi.name: Tony Hoare Room
poi.info: Seminar room named after Sir CAR Hoare, former head of the CS dept and inventor of the quicksort.

poi.name: Natural History Museum
poi.info: The Oxford University Museum of Natural History houses the University's scientific collections of zoological, entomological and geological specimens. The Museum itself is a Grade 1 listed building, renowned for its spectacular neo-Gothic architecture. Among its most famous features are the Oxfordshire dinosaurs, the dodo, and the swifts in the tower. (Source: oum.ox.ac.uk)

poi.name: Robert Hooke Building
poi.info: Part of the CS dept, named after scientist and microbiology pioneer Robert Hooke.
